metadata.title: CVE-2018-5784 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In LibTIFF 4.0.9, there is an uncontrolled resource consumption in theTIFFSetDirectory function of tif_dir.c. Remote attackers could leveragethis vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted tif file.This occurs because the declared number of directory entries is notvalidated against the actual number of directory entries.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.3').
